clinical_study.brief_title: Multidimensional Individualized Nutritional Therapy for Individuals With Severe COPD
clinical_study.official_title: Multidimensional INDividualized NUTritional Therapy for Individuals With Severe Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease

brief_summary.textblock:
Individuals with severe chronic pulmonary disease often life isolated with a high burden of symptoms. Nutritional risk and low quality of life are common, and both associated with increased societal cost and poor prognosis. COPD is a complex and progressive disease with changing clinical states that influences nutritional status and quality of life in different ways. The primary aim is to improve quality of life for individuals with severe COPD.
120 individuals are recruited from the outpatient clinic at Nordsjællands Hospital in Denmark to a randomized controlled trial with two parallel groups (intervention and control). The intervention will last for 12 weeks comprising four dimensions including nutritional plan, regular contact, informal caregiver/friendly reminder and a weight dairy.
We expect that the intervention will improve quality of life, nutritional status and prognosis.

primary_outcome.description: Will be measured using the EQ-5D-5L

secondary_outcome.description: Measured using EQ-5D-5L.
Measured using handdynanometer
Measured using Stand Chair Test

Measured using the FRAILscale. The FRAILscale contains five categories including Fatigue (F): is the participant tired, Resistance (R): Does the participant experience difficulty walking up one flight of stairs, Ambulation (A): Does the participant experience difficulty walking 200 meters, Illnesses (I): Does the participant have more than five illnesses, Loss of weight (L): Has the participant lost more than 5% weight within the last year. Each question is answered with "Yes" or "No". "No" gives 0 points and "Yes" gives 1 point. For a total score of 0,1-2 and 3-5 the participant is categorized as "robust", "pre-frail" and "frail", respectively.
Obtained from patient files
Obtained from patient files

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of contacts to outpatient clinic
secondary_outcome.description: Obtained from patient files

secondary_outcome.measure: Impact of COPD on everyday life
secondary_outcome.description: Obtained using COPD Assessment test (CAT). CAT contains 8 items with a scoring range of 0-40. The total score indicate the impact level COPD has on the everyday life ranging from low to very high. A total score of 5 is referred to the upper limit of normal in healthy non-smokers, a total score <10 indicate low impact, 10-20 indicate medium impact, whereas >20 and >30 indicate high and very high impact, respectively.
Self-reported. The participant is asked if he/she is currently using home oxygen.
Obtained from patient files supplemented with self-reported information
will be obtained from patient files

Measured using Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale. The scale contains two subscales to evaluate risk of anxiety and depression. Each subscale contains 7 items with a total score from 0-21. Risk of anxiety and depression are based on a total score ≥8.
Measured using mini nutritional assessment test and/or Nutritional Risk Screening 2002
weight measured on an electronic scale to the nearest 0.1 kg
Calculated as weight (kg)/height (m2)
Measured using a measuring tape to the nearest 0.1 cm
Measured using a measuring tape to the nearest 0.1 cm
Measured using a measuring tape to the nearest 0.1 cm
Measured using bioelectrical impedance analysis
Measured using bioelectrical impedance analysis

arm_group.description: Intervention contains: individual nutritional plan regular contact friendly reminder/informal caregiver and weight dairy.

intervention.description: The four dimensions of MINDNUT are described below: Nutritional plan: is conducted in collaboration with the participant based on nutritional registration and information about routines and habits to reach a daily protein target of 1.5 g/kg/day. The nutritional plan is adjusted at the regular contact, and nutritional supplementation will be handed out to the participant. Friendly reminder/informal caregiver: is a friendly reminder that encourage the participant to follow the nutritional plan and to ask for support (a note to hang on the refrigerator). The informal caregiver is a person with close contact to the participant. Regular contacts: The participant will be contacted on regular basis (with an interval of 7-14 days) via phone and besides nutritional plan, this conversation will be used to talk about well-being, compliance and potential side-effects. Weight diary: participants is instructed in keeping a weight diary which include registration of a daily weight.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ≥ 35 years
- Severe COPD (GOLD score D)
- Able to eat orally
- Live in own home
- Speak Danish or English
- Nutritional risk/Undernourished (based on nutritional risk screening)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Cancer
- Dysphagia
- Food allergy
- Unable to sign informed consent
- Hospitalized within the last 14 days

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Pulmonary and Infectious Diseases, Nordsjællands Hospital, 3400 Hillerød, Denmark
